Meaning: A message given to the Traffic Controller confirming that it is safe for traction current to be switched on and/or train services to restart after engineering work has been carried out on a section of the Main Line, or after an operating incident where staff or passengers have been on the track.
Used to advise train operators to move forward carefully, typically in situations where there may be hazards or reduced visibility.
A document that contains all the details including electrical isolations, given by the Traffic Controller to a Track Protection Officer or a Possession Controller for accessing the track.
Indicates a malfunction in the track circuitry system, which can affect signalling and track occupancy detection.
Accessing into an area which is on or near the track.

A message given to the Traffic Controller confirming that it is safe for traction current to be switched on and/or train services to restart after engineering work has been carried out on a section of the Main Line, or after an operating incident where staff or passengers have been on the track.
Electro-mechanical process by which points are proved in the direction set.
Completion of work and ready to give line clear message.

The latest time by which the Track Protection Officer or the Possession Controller must call back the OCC/DCC to surrender his Track Occupation Authority when working on or near the mainline track in Non-Traffic hours.
